title: [BUG] This image loses a lot of data when opened and resaved
body:
**Description**

Run the following code using the attached image `i9.jpg`. Compare `i9.jpg` to `i10.jpg`. A lot of data has been lost. Take a look at the tiles on the floor, and the wave of the curtains behind. Do not use a web browser to view the images, since they use Skia. Use something like Windows Photo Viewer.

Really this is an [YCCK](https://blog.idrsolutions.com/2010/05/understanding-the-pdf-file-format-cmyk-does-not-always-mean-cmyk/) image, so ideally Skia should do the YCCK conversion. [JpegBitmapDecoder](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.media.imaging.jpegbitmapdecoder?view=netframework-4.7.2) does. However most programs do not do the conversion, so it's fine if Skia doesn't. But the fact that Skia loses data when opening it is a bug, since most programs do not.

**Code**

``` C#
var img = SKImage.FromEncodedData("i9.jpg");
using (var file = File.Create("i10.png"))
	img.Encode(SKEncodedImageFormat.Png, 100).SaveTo(file);
```

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.0
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Windows Classic:  Windows 10

**Attachments**

i9.jpg

![i9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1690985/55682026-0f38d680-5936-11e9-8d20-fec62d2f7346.jpg)
